com.google.devtools.common.options

Class OptionsBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.devtools.common.options.OptionsBase

  • public abstract class OptionsBase
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for all options classes. Extend this class, adding public instance fields annotated with @Option. Then you can create instances either programmatically: 
       X x = Options.getDefaults(X.class);
   x.host = "localhost";
   x.port = 80;
    or from an array of command-line arguments: 
       OptionsParser parser = OptionsParser.newOptionsParser(X.class);
   parser.parse("--host", "localhost", "--port", "80");
   X x = parser.getOptions(X.class);

    Subclasses of OptionsBase must be constructed reflectively, i.e. using not new MyOptions, but one of the two methods above instead. (Direct construction creates an empty instance, not containing default values. This leads to surprising behavior and often NullPointerExceptions, etc.)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected OptionsBase()
      Subclasses must provide a default (no argument) constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • asMap

        public final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> asMap()
        Returns this options object in the form of a (new) mapping from option names, including inherited ones, to option values. If the public fields are mutated, this will be reflected in subsequent calls to asMap. Mutation of this map by the caller does not affect this options object.

      • toString

        public final java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • cacheKey

        public final java.lang.String cacheKey()
        Returns a string that uniquely identifies the options. This value is intended for analysis caching.
